Albert Einstein  

Born: March 14, 1879

Education: PhD in Physics, University of Zurich, 1905

Experience:
- Patent Examiner, Swiss Patent Office, 1902-1909
- Professor of Theoretical Physics, University of Berlin, 1914-1933
- Visiting Professor, Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton, 1933-1955

Publications:
- "On the Electrodynamics of Moving Bodies" (1905)
- "General Theory of Relativity" (1915)
- "The World As I See It" (1949)

Awards:
- Nobel Prize in Physics, 1921
- Copley Medal, 1925
- Time Magazine Person of the Century, 1999

Amusement Park Character Performer:  

As a character performer, you will bring to life beloved characters in a vibrant amusement park setting. Your role involves interacting with guests, posing for photos, and participating in parades and shows. A background in theater or performance is a plus!
